through the pattern first to give you a better understanding of what you will need to do colours are for reference only and will vary based on lighting monitor settings and devices 1 my m om s charity group recently had a preemie beanie drive when she asked me to make a few i almost fell out of my chair seeing how little a person s head could be so unbelievably tiny the pattern is written for a slightly larger prem baby and is a really great way to us e up scraps as it takes less than 10g of yarn to make you can also use different yarn weights and hook sizes for some variation in size if you are making these to donate please always remember to check with the charit y for any special requirements they might have for these tiny little lives for example some special care nurseries request that beanies not be made with yellow yarns as the babies are often jaundiced the beanies also need to be wa shable at high temperatures and the yarn needs to be soft for baby s fragile and sensitive skin you might also want to avoid any metallic threads/sparkles which can scratch and are sometimes problematic in humid cribs materials ➢ any yarn of your choice just make sure it is very soft you can play around with your scraps to make some pretty colour combinations for mine i used a variegated yarn but a hint from my testers use a second contrasting colour for rounds 4 5 6 then 11 and 12 for a lovely effect ➢ i used katia candy for baby ➢ 3 5mm hook stuffs to know this pattern uses us terminology you will note that my starting chain for a double_crochet and half_double_crochet is 2 i e ch2 this is just a personal preference you are welcome to start with ch3 for a double_crochet and ch2 for a half_double_crochet or even start with a standing stitch do what is comfortable for you parentheses indicate a repeat you will need to repeat this set of instructions the specified amount of times square brackets indicate a complete repeat you will need to repeat this set of instructions
